website_summaries.verdict: The ATC3K Action Camera is rugged enough to take the knocks of extreme sports; however, it falls flat when it comes to video and photo quality.
pros: The ATC3K's waterproof, shockproof design takes bumps and splashes in stride
The Webcam and live monitor functions enhance the usefulness of the camera
cons: The unit only captures VGA video, which is fairly low resolution by today's standards
Front-heavy design makes the unit difficult to mount stably
The ATC3K does not feature a still photography mode

customer_reviews.title: Not a "waterproof webcam"
customer_reviews.text: I used this to stream the outdoor weather from my cabin. It was pretty inexpensive, claimed to be waterproof, and was Prime- so my shipping was fast and free. Turns out, it wasn't a "waterproof webcam" it is a "waterproof camera" with "webcam capabilities". In other words, you have to take off the cap that makes it water proof to use it as a webcam. It was pretty tricky wording that kind of reminded me of "bait and switch". I gave it 3 stars because I'm sure it works fine, but was frustrating to be deceived.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: It has been bad over 2 decades.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible then, still terrible now. I bought this for a deployment to Iraq and it was sub par at the time- I thought it would be fun to take. It was not. I tried it again for kicks and giggles after these years to sees if it wold be fun to mess around with for a while. It wasn’t. Just a poorly executed camera. At least it was cheap and it would be hard to find one now to disappoint you!
customer_reviews.author: Edward A.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because I wanted an action cam to film some dog-sledding. However, I ended up using more for my snowboarding. I like the durablility of it & the ease of use. The only drawbacks were that buttons were difficult to depress. I often had to remove my gloves just to start filming & stop filming and even then it was difficult. Also, the sound quality was lacking. It picked up mostly ambient sound but not my voice. However, I am still learning how to use it. Overall, the video quality is good. Many people liked the video quality once I put on the PC.
customer_reviews.author: L. Manalo

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just for fun.... For the price OK, but the images aren't so good. 640X480 is a very poor definition. I sold mine and bought a contour. I know the Contour is more (really more) expensive but worse. Believe me!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Antonio da Silva e Silva

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these to take with me on a motorcycle trip thru Peru. The camera stopped working half way thru the trip. the problem is that the memory card reader does not make good contact with the memory card. any little vibration will make the unit turn off. DO NOT BUY ONE OF THESE. GO AHEAD AND SPEND THE EXTRA CHEESE ON A HERO CAM.
customer_reviews.author: Ridesmorethanyoudo

customer_reviews.title: Video Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little camera for the money. I use it to record my rides on my ATV. It could use some different ways to attach it to stuff , but all and all a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bethel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, and an improvement over earlier models. I particularly liked the new on and off buttons, much easier to use. Batteries are easier to change, and I really like the added threaded connector used on cameras and tripods, makes it much more useful. As with the previous versions, the video quality is excellent. The web cam function is great, just wish it could record at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: James W. England

customer_reviews.title: I liked it, but could be a little better
customer_reviews.text: It works like review's product, but has 2 problems in my opinion (test only in Mountain Bike sections): 1- Sound must be turned off, because the wind noise during the ride; 2- To use attached over helmet, this one must be very tightened in your head otherwise the helmet will shake a lot (and the video too); But it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. O. Alcantara

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: good for the price i bought this camera cause i lost my go pro hd but recently got it returned to me for the price this is a good camera straight forward use and all but the picture quality doesn't compare to the go pro hd but the go pro hd is like 4 times the cost of this one
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was defective due to such poor audio, but after seeing other reviews; it seems to be a common problem. Video quality is not the best, but usable. Spend a little more and try a different one is my advise.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 14

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a several types of these helmet cams online. This seems to be a pretty good one for the price. I purchased it as a gift for a dirt bike rider. He used it in an hour and a half race and was pretty happy with the quality of the video, although he had to duct take it on to his helmet. The straps that come with it wouldn't keep it steady enough. He turned it on for a second race and it stopped after just a few minutes. We think the batteries wore out but we haven't verified that yet. So it might take a lot of juice.
customer_reviews.author: czehn

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, easy controls, poor sound
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this camera both on my helmet and my mountain bike and took it on some singletrack adventures. I had several wipeouts where I landed on the camera or the camera directly hit the ground, and it continues to work great! Since it is waterproof as well as shock-resistant, there are no microphone openings, which means that the sound quality is very poor. I just disabled the audio. Overall - I was very impressed with the durability, ease of use, and all of the mounting hardware that it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sinks

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I like to take video of all my trips and give them to family or to the people that go with us. I put this on my Harley and took video of my last motorcycle trip. It worked out great. There is a $500 dollar version that someone makes that has more bells and whistles (i.e. like playing back what you've done) but for the money this was an excellent buy and meets my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hartt

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little thing
customer_reviews.text: This cam is great. I attach it to my sailboat's mast with one of the many attachments it comes with...it records the highs of sounds.. but heck, its waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: William Black

customer_reviews.title: Useful Tool
customer_reviews.text: This camera has absolutley horrible audio quality, however, this is not a big issue as I only need the video. It works best outside on bright days, for instance snowboarding, or riding a motorcycle. I attached it to my snorkeling mask and it was pretty effective. The video quality is a little better than a cellphones. Worth it if you do crazy stuff and are likely to break a nicer camera.
customer_reviews.author: Aragorn

customer_reviews.title: Action Cam
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the accessories which come with this cam. the quality of the images are on a good base, sound is not really fine, but it's a action cam, not a digital mic. overall i'm happy with it, reasonable price for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Livio Patera

product_meta.title: Oregon Scientific ATC 3K Waterproof Action Cam Flash Memory Video Recorder with Web Cam Capabilities (Black)
product_meta.description: Dirt, Snow, Rain, or Shine, capture all the action with the ultimate, all-terrain digital video camera! It's even WATERPROOF up to 3 meters with NO additional casing! With an expanded 48 degree Field of View, the hands free digital video and audio captures all the thrill of your adventure in 640X480 VGA resolution (up to 30 frames per second) with the 32 MB internal memory (expandable to 4GB with built-in SD drive, 4GB card not included). It's 3 button operation mode and the added webcam feature makes the ATC3K not only incredibly user friendly but increasingly versatile. This product comes standard with a carrying case and all the mounting accessories necessary for easy connectivity to helmets, bikes, and a wide array of other equipment. It also comes with a webcam stand and webcam installation CD. Both USB and RCA cables for quick, direct playback on either your PC or TV (NTSC) are part of the package as well. PC requirements: Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows Vista, OSX10.4 and below. (Webcam not for MAC)
feature_bullets: 32mB Internal Memory, expandable up to 4GB with built in SD drive (SD card not included)
Web Cam Capabilities with Stand Included (Webcam not for Mac)
PC requirements: Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows Vista, OS X 10.4 and below

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.5 out of 5 stars26 ratings2.5 out of 5 stars
